intro: Cremastosperma williamsii, commonly known as Williams' burr, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by hairy, spiny pods that contain seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect species.
